Description: Papyrus. Demotic mathematical problems recto and verso. The papyrus is torn on both sides and at the top and bottom. On the recto there are the remains of 14 lines of text. On the verso there are two columns. Column 1 contains the ends of 11 lines of text. Column 2 contains the introduction to a new section. There are the beginnings of two lines of text, but the space below (7 cm) is blank. There is also a tiny unattached fragment in the frame that contains traces of a couple of signs.
Curator's comments: The recto contains a series of calculations, but is written as one continuous text. Column 2 on the verso begins with p3 gy, '(here is) the way of'. On the basis of the script, it seems highly likely that this text belongs with 10936 and 10947.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380985) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380985)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: brittle, fragile, frayed, insect attack Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape, kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
